intro: Phyllorkis weddellii, commonly known as the Weddell's flax, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Phyllorkis weddellii is typically found in grasslands and rocky habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
